abstract.p: Prof Joseph Davis letter on Dec 22 editorial urges effort to help bilingual New York City students become or remain literate in their native languages

block.p: If bilingual schoolchildren in New York City are going to be moved more quickly into English-only classrooms (''Repairing Bilingual Education,'' editorial, Dec. 22), what is going to be done to ensure that they become literate or remain so in their native languages, thereby retaining a more direct access to the cultures their families bring with them to this city? When they reach high school, will students from Latin America, for example, read Gabriel Garcia Marquez in English translation?
The writer is an assistant professor of linguistics at City College of New York, CUNY.
